sources.title: Love Affair
sources.description: Directed by Leo McCarey, this 1939 romantic classic is the first and best version of the old warhorse of a fateful shipboard romance between an aimless playboy and a nightclub singer, both engaged but appearing to be destined to reunite on the top floor of the Empire State Building. The elaborate, shot-for-shot 1957 remake again directed by McCarey with Cary Grant and Deborah Kerr is much better known, and Warren Beatty even saw fit to remake it yet again with his wife Annette Bening for a 1994 update featuring an 87-year old Katharine Hepburn in her last film role.

sources.description: One of the greatest romance movies from the golden age of Hollywood. They agree to meet again in 6 months time but will a series of accidents stop them from making their planned rendez-vous.

sources.title: Love Affair (1939) | Colorized Public Domain Romantic Drama with Irene Dunne and Charles Boyer
sources.description:
Love Affair (1939) is an American romantic drama film directed by Leo McCarey, produced by RKO Radio Pictures, and written by Delmer Daves and Donald Ogden Stewart. This restored and colorized public domain classic is the original screen version of a timeless love story later remade as An Affair to Remember (1957). By presenting the 1939 original in high-quality color, audiences in the United States, Europe, and beyond can rediscover the elegance of Old Hollywood romance at its peak, with unforgettable performances by Irene Dunne and Charles Boyer.

Plot Summary:
Michel Marnet (Charles Boyer), a sophisticated French painter, and Terry McKay (Irene Dunne), a charming American singer, meet aboard a transatlantic ocean liner traveling from Europe to New York. Though both are engaged to others, their chance encounter blossoms into a passionate romance that neither can ignore.

During the voyage, Michel and Terry struggle to reconcile their feelings with their existing commitments. To test whether their love is real and not just a fleeting infatuation, they make a solemn pact: if they still feel the same way after six months, they will reunite at the top of the Empire State Building. This iconic promise becomes the emotional anchor of the story.

However, fate intervenes on the day of their reunion. Tragedy strikes when Terry is injured in a car accident, leaving her unable to walk. Out of pride and love, she hides her condition from Michel, believing she must not be a burden to him. Their eventual revelation and reconciliation provide one of the most moving climaxes in 1930s cinema, cementing Love Affair as a deeply emotional tale of destiny, sacrifice, and the power of true love.
